content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully placed on the map during these steps. Multiple recovery attempts were made to craft and position a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs to support research, but the Lab was never produced due to missing inventory and resource shortages.
• The agent did interact with pre‐existing furnace structures (e.g., one at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) used for iron plate smelting and another at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for copper plate production); however, these were not constructed as new elements.

ERROR TIPS
• API Invocation and Return Value Handling
  – Use the correct parameter signature when calling get_entities. Do not include unsupported keywords (such as “radius”) or pass extra positional arguments. Verify the function signature to ensure compatibility.
  – Always check that function calls return valid iterables (rather than None) before attempting to iterate over them to avoid TypeErrors.

• Lab Placement and Crafting Chain Issues
  – Confirm that the required Lab item is present in the inventory before attempting placement. Attempting to place an entity that is not in inventory results in placement errors.
  – Ensure that all necessary sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available and producible. Verify that the complete crafting chain is operational, so that crafting complex items like a Lab does not fail due to missing dependencies.
  – Perform inventory and resource checks ahead of crafting attempts so that shortages (such as insufficient iron-plates, copper-plates, or other intermediates) are identified and remedied before reattempting production.
